Example 9—Prove the most important rule
$$ M = \frac{E I}{R} $$
applied to a loaded beam; M and I having their usual meanings, and R being the radius of curvature of the bent beam.
Assuming the beam to be originally straight, take a section of length l along the neutral lamina, and let l + \ell be the strained length at distance y (Fig. 108).

blocks.caption: Fig. 108—Problem on Loaded Beam.
blocks.description: The figure illustrates a beam under load, showing the original and strained lengths, as well as the distance y and how it relates to the radius of curvature R.
